metadata.title: CVE-2014-3743 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in the Marked modulebefore 0.3.1 for Node.js allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary webscript or HTML via vectors related to (1) gfm codeblocks (language) or (2)javascript url's.sanitize: trueEven if this option is set, marked is vulnerable to content injection in multiple locations if untrusted user input is allowed to be provided into marked and that output is passed to the browser.Injection is possible in two locations * gfm codeblocks (language) * javascript url's

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3743` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjs-marked - 0.3.1+dfsg-1
node-marked - 0.3.1+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: node-marked package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.3.1+dfsg-1').
